20101201020323.857|20101201020325.286|CCO|PENTAGON STUDY ON THE EFFECTS OF
20101201020325.286|20101201020326.714|CCO|ENDING "DON'T ASK, DON'T TELL"
20101201020326.714|20101201020328.143|CCO|WAS RELEASED TODAY.
20101201020328.143|20101201020329.571|CCO|IT CONCLUDED THERE COULD BE
20101201020329.571|20101201020331.000|CCO|INITIAL DISRUPTIONS FROM
20101201020331.000|20101201020334.333|CCO|DROPPING THE BAN ON GAYS SERVING
20101201020334.333|20101201020337.667|CCO|OPENLY IN THE RANKS, BUT THERE
20101201020337.667|20101201020341.000|CCO|WOULD BE NO LONG-LASTING
20101201020341.000|20101201020342.429|CCO|PROBLEMS.
20101201020342.429|20101201020343.857|CCO|THE PENTAGON STUDY BEGAN TEN
20101201020343.857|20101201020345.286|CCO|MONTHS AGO.
20101201020345.286|20101201020346.714|CCO|THE QUESTION: WHAT HAPPENS IF
20101201020346.714|20101201020348.143|CCO|CONGRESS REPEALS THE POLICY
20101201020348.143|20101201020349.571|CCO|THAT FORCED MORE THAN 13,000
20101201020349.571|20101201020351.000|CCO|PERSONNEL TO LEAVE THE
20101201020351.000|20101201020354.333|CCO|MILITARY IN THE LAST 17 YEARS.
20101201020354.333|20101201020357.667|CCO|SOME 115,000 TROOPS RESPONDED
20101201020357.667|20101201020401.000|CCO|TO A MAILED QUESTIONNAIRE.
20101201020401.000|20101201020403.000|CCO|70% SAID ALLOWING GAYS AND
20101201020403.000|20101201020405.000|CCO|LESBIANS TO SERVE OPENLY WOULD
20101201020405.000|20101201020407.000|CCO|HAVE POSITIVE, MIXED OR NO
20101201020407.000|20101201020409.000|CCO|EFFECT.
20101201020409.000|20101201020411.000|CCO|ON THE OTHER HAND, 30%
20101201020411.000|20101201020413.000|CCO|PREDICTED NEGATIVE EFFECTS.
20101201020413.000|20101201020415.000|CCO|AMONG COMBAT TROOPS 40% WERE
20101201020415.000|20101201020417.000|CCO|OPPOSED TO THE IDEA.
20101201020417.000|20101201020419.000|CCO|THAT FIGURE CLIMBED TO 46%
20101201020419.000|20101201020421.000|CCO|AMONG U.S. MARINES WHO
20101201020421.000|20101201020422.667|CCO|ANSWERED THE SURVEY.
20101201020422.667|20101201020424.333|CCO|DEFENSE SECRETARY GATES AND
20101201020424.333|20101201020426.000|CCO|THE CHAIRMAN OF THE JOINT
20101201020426.000|20101201020427.667|CCO|CHIEFS ADMIRAL MIKE MULLEN
20101201020427.667|20101201020429.333|CCO|FAVOR LIFTING THE BAN AS DOES
20101201020429.333|20101201020431.000|CCO|PRESIDENT OBAMA.
20101201020431.000|20101201020433.500|CCO|AT A BRIEFING TODAY, GATES
20101201020433.500|20101201020436.000|CCO|ADDRESSED THE COMBAT UNIT
20101201020436.000|20101201020438.500|CCO|CONCERNS.
20101201020438.500|20101201020441.000|CCO|>> PART OF THIS IS A QUESTION
20101201020441.000|20101201020444.333|CCO|OF UNFAMILIAR YARD, PART OF IT
20101201020444.333|20101201020447.667|CCO|IS STEREOTYPES.
20101201020447.667|20101201020451.000|CCO|AND PART OF IT IS JUST SORT OF
20101201020451.000|20101201020454.333|CCO|INHERENT RESISTANCE TO CHANGE
20101201020454.333|20101201020457.667|CCO|WHEN YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT'S ON
20101201020457.667|20101201020501.000|CCO|THE OTHER SIDE.
20101201020501.000|20101201020503.000|CCO|SO I THINK THAT THE CONTRAST
20101201020503.000|20101201020505.000|CCO|BETWEEN THE SIGNIFICANT LEVELS
20101201020505.000|20101201020507.000|CCO|OF CONCERN FOR THOSE WHO
20101201020507.000|20101201020509.000|CCO|HAD... WHO SAID THEY HAD NEVER
20101201020509.000|20101201020511.000|CCO|SERVED WITH SOMEONE WHO WAS
20101201020511.000|20101201020512.667|CCO|GAY AS OPPOSED TO THOSE WHO
20101201020512.667|20101201020514.333|CCO|HAD IS AN IMPORTANT
20101201020514.333|20101201020516.000|CCO|CONSIDERATION.
20101201020516.000|20101201020517.667|CCO|>> Lehrer: IN FACT, THE REPORT
20101201020517.667|20101201020519.333|CCO|FOUND THAT 92% OF TROOPS WHO
20101201020519.333|20101201020521.000|CCO|HAVE WORKED WITH A GAY COME
20101201020521.000|20101201020523.000|CCO|RAID SAID THE EXPERIENCE WAS
20101201020523.000|20101201020525.000|CCO|GOOD, VERY GOOD OR HAD NO
20101201020525.000|20101201020527.000|CCO|IMPACT ON OPERATIONS.
20101201020527.000|20101201020529.000|CCO|AND REGARDLESS, BOTH GATES AND

20101201020803.222|20101201020804.333|CCO|THE SENATE ARMED SERVICES
20101201020804.333|20101201020805.444|CCO|COMMITTEE WILL HOLD HEARINGS

20101201020826.000|20101201020827.250|CCO|EUROPE.
20101201020827.250|20101201020828.500|CCO|GENERAL, PRESIDENT OBAMA SAID
20101201020828.500|20101201020829.750|CCO|LATE TODAY THAT YOUR STUDY
20101201020829.750|20101201020831.000|CCO|PROVES THAT DON'T ASK DON'T
20101201020831.000|20101201020832.667|CCO|TELL CAN BE IMPLEMENTED
20101201020832.667|20101201020834.333|CCO|RESPONSIBLY.
20101201020834.333|20101201020836.000|CCO|DO YOU AGREE WITH THAT?
20101201020836.000|20101201020837.667|CCO|>> I DO.
20101201020837.667|20101201020839.333|CCO|I THINK WE CAN IF THE LAW
20101201020839.333|20101201020841.000|CCO|CHANGES I THINK THE UNIFORMED
20101201020841.000|20101201020842.429|CCO|MILITARY CAN EXECUTE AND
20101201020842.429|20101201020843.857|CCO|IMPLEMENT THE CHANGE TO THE
20101201020843.857|20101201020845.286|CCO|LAW WITH LOW RISK TO THE
20101201020845.286|20101201020846.714|CCO|FORCE.
20101201020846.714|20101201020848.143|CCO|>> Lehrer: DO YOU AGREE?
20101201020848.143|20101201020849.571|CCO|>> YES, SIR, I DO.
20101201020849.571|20101201020851.000|CCO|I THINK THAT OUR STUDY WHICH
20101201020851.000|20101201020853.000|CCO|WAS THE MOST COMPREHENSIVE
20101201020853.000|20101201020855.000|CCO|ENGAGEMENT OF THE FORCE ON ANY
20101201020855.000|20101201020857.000|CCO|PERSONNEL-RELATED ISSUE
20101201020857.000|20101201020859.000|CCO|DEMONSTRATES THAT MOST SERVICE
20101201020859.000|20101201020901.000|CCO|MEMBERS SIMPLY DON'T REGARD
20101201020901.000|20101201020903.000|CCO|THIS AS AN ISSUE AT THIS POINT.
20101201020903.000|20101201020905.000|CCO|MANY ACTUALLY SEE POSITIVE
20101201020905.000|20101201020907.000|CCO|EFFECTS OF REPEAL IN TERMS OF
20101201020907.000|20101201020909.000|CCO|UNIT COHESION AND THE ABILITY
20101201020909.000|20101201020911.000|CCO|TO WORK TOGETHER.
20101201020911.000|20101201020913.000|CCO|>> Lehrer: GENERAL, THE STUDY,
20101201020913.000|20101201020915.000|CCO|YOUR STUDY, COMES UP WITH JUST
20101201020915.000|20101201020917.000|CCO|THE OPPOSITE OF WHERE THE
20101201020917.000|20101201020919.000|CCO|MILITARY LEADERSHIP HAS BEEN
20101201020919.000|20101201020921.000|CCO|FOR YEARS INCLUDING SOME OF
20101201020921.000|20101201020922.250|CCO|THE THE LEADERS NOW.
20101201020922.250|20101201020923.500|CCO|THE OTHER MEMBERS OF THE JOINT
20101201020923.500|20101201020924.750|CCO|CHIEFS OF STAFF HAVE SPOKEN
20101201020924.750|20101201020926.000|CCO|OUT ON THIS.
20101201020926.000|20101201020927.250|CCO|WHY THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN HOW
20101201020927.250|20101201020928.500|CCO|THE LEADERS FEEL AND THE HOW
20101201020928.500|20101201020929.750|CCO|THE TROOPS FEEL.
20101201020929.750|20101201020931.000|CCO|>> ONE OF THE INTERESTING

20101201025144.333|20101201025146.000|CCO|HE PRESSED THE INMATES' LAWYER
20101201025146.000|20101201025147.667|CCO|MR. SPECTER ABOUT THE NUMBER
20101201025147.667|20101201025149.333|CCO|THAT THE COURT HAD ORDERED
20101201025149.333|20101201025151.000|CCO|HERE IN TERMS OF THE NUMBER OF
20101201025151.000|20101201025153.000|CCO|INMATES TO BE RELEASED.
20101201025153.000|20101201025155.000|CCO|HE SAID IF I WERE A CITIZEN OF
20101201025155.000|20101201025157.000|CCO|CALIFORNIA, I WOULD BE
20101201025157.000|20101201025159.000|CCO|CONCERNED.

20101201025206.000|20101201025207.667|CCO|BELIEVED THAT THERE WOULD BE

20101201025214.333|20101201025216.000|CCO|GOING TO BE AN INCREASE IN
20101201025216.000|20101201025217.667|CCO|CRIME IF THIS GOES THROUGH.
